page.title: 01GLOSSOPDALE 1985
page.content: The first settlers in Glosspdale appear to have been the{Anglo-saxons} ,one of whom -{Glott}- gave his name to the valley. The villages which are recorded in the {Domesday Book}are still easily identified today. Glossopdale entered a period of growing prosperity with the increasing demand for{textiles}in the 17th. century. Its mountain streams provided the power for the early woollen and cotton mills so that the area was well placed to enter the age of the true{Industrial Revolution}with the invention of the steam engine. With the decline of cotton Glossop also entered a period of falling population, but in the 1960s its{rail {link to Manchester}13 miles to the west made it a popular dormitory town, with a{poulation}of nearly 30,000.
